title: CPI doesn't reflect improvements in quality

content.question: The consumer price index (CPI) does not measure the true cost of inflation because

choices.label: improvements in the quality of goods or services are not fully reflected
lenders are better off when actual inflation is less than anticipated inflation
borrowers are better off when actual inflation is greater than anticipated inflation
changes in consumersâ€™ real income are not accounted for
consumers may substitute toward more expensive goods without being significantly worse off

content.answer: improvements in the quality of goods or services are not fully reflected
